TopicTitle: Question about hitting esc to revert a mission

Articles.Content:
All

Is there a penalty to hitting escape and starting a mission over in mid flight?  Curious as it makes it seem like cheating.  If no penalty, is it something most people don't do?

Thx

jonpfl

It's as much cheating as putting a bucket inside your sandcastle to make it stronger. Unless you're in a competition with strict rules, no one really cares.

There's also many cases where reversing is unequivocally "legit":

  • You're building a craft and at the launch pad realizing, because you took out a part, KSP decided to shuffle up your staging order
  • And after fixing that, KSP decided to put crew back in your craft that's supposed to launch crewless (because it's an unwieldy space station without abort facilities)
  • While adding a maneuver node, KSP decides that it's actually "time warp here" and by the time you've stopped it, you've missed the window for a rendez-vous or circularization
  • The kraken strikes
  • Etc
How could there be a penalty? If you revert the flight, it never happened.
I do it all the time. No real penalty, unless its a self imposed one on career.
